statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Arkansas 68, Tulsa 59
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- In its final nonconference tune-up, Arkansas was looking to get off to a quick start against a resurgent Tulsa squad. Didn't happen that way. Tulsa missed its first 10 shots and Arkansas was just a little better. Thirteen minutes into the first half, they had a combined 4-of-26 from the field. But the Razorbacks (11-3) got it going in the second half, using their press to force turnovers and get points on the way to a 68-59 victory Tuesday over the Golden Hurricanes (9-3). "Some of the shots we normally knock down we were missing in the first half," Arkansas guard Gary Ervin said. "But we kind of picked each other up as a team and made up for it in the second half." Ervin scored 14 points and led a Razorbacks' fast break that produced 17 fast break points and 22 points off turnovers. Sonny Weems also scored 14. "That's where were trying to build our identity is on defense," Ervin said. "Trying to stop our opponents from doing what they want to do. Trying to get steals and get in transition." Arkansas' 12-point first half lead shrank in the second half to just one point, 33-32, on a pair of free throws by Mark Hill, who scored a game-high 17 points. Arkansas' Steven Hill forced a Jamel McLean turnover and fed Ervin for a lay-up. Steven Hill then got a steal and again fed Ervin for a lay-up as Arkansas went ahead 37-32. Tulsa pulled within 42-40 on a Mark Hill 3-pointer with 13 minutes left in the game. With the shot clock at zero, Vincent Hunter took a pass from Ervin and scored inside. Arkansas then went on an 8-0 run that gave the Razorbacks enough cushion. Patrick Beverley scored 11 points and led the rally. Charles Thomas added 13 points. Steven Hill played a season-high 33 minutes and his inside defense was instrumental in Arkansas forcing 21 Tulsa turnovers. "(Hill) worked his tail off tonight," Arkansas coach Stan Heath said. "He came up with the ball and got penetration when we needed it. He played hard and had intensity." Ben Uzoh added 11 points for Tulsa and McLean scored 10. Darian Townes did not rejoin the team after halftime. Heath said Townes "got frustrated in the first half and he went to the locker room and stayed there." Heath said he would meet with Townes on Wednesday. He said Townes was still on the team. "He's an emotional guy and he knows I'm disappointed in him," Heath said.
